intro: Audouinia esterhuyseniae, commonly known as the Esterhuysenia lichen, is a rare and specialized lichen that thrives in specific environmental conditions. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its unique thallus structure, which is typically crustose or foliose. The lichen forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic algae and a fungal partner, enabling it to survive in nutrient-poor environments. It is often found on rock surfaces or tree bark in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many areas.
